    • Method Detail

      • getAppData

        public void getAppData(Map<String,Object> params,
              ISirqulCallback<AppResponse> callback)

        Get the application data structure. The basic structure is a node tree, with the root node being a AppResponse. The response contains the user's profile, messages from the system, and a list of MissionResponse. A mission can have any number of GameResponse's but typically is a single game type. A game then has any number of PackResponse's which help group the game levels. Packs are then composed of any number of GameLevelResponse's.

        Using the various parameters can return the applications default mission (built-in packs to play), the list of community levels published, the user's saved levels, or explicity levels desired. You can choose to include the profile or not, or just return parts of the profile. You can also filter out game levels that have been published with a higher version of the application.

        Target API Endpoint: /app/get

        Available parameters for this api

        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required).
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          if true then include the game data blob, otherwise don't include.
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          keyword string used to filter the search results when looking for community and saved levels.
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          how to sort the results when looking for community and saved levels. possible values are:
          LEVEL_NAME, LEVEL_CREATED, LEVEL_UPDATED, LEVEL_LIKES, LEVEL_DISLIKES, LEVEL_NOTES, LEVEL_PLAYS.
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          order the search results descending or ascending when looking for community and saved levels.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          start the search results at a record.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          limit the search results to some number.
        • SirqulKeys.gameObjectCount
          if true then include the game object count, otherwise don't include.
        • SirqulKeys.filter
          restrict the search to items with certain permissions, possible values are:
          MINE, FRIENDS, PUBLIC, ALL_PUBLIC, ALL, LIKED
        • SirqulKeys.dateCreated
          restrict the search to items created less then date
        • SirqulKeys.ownerId
          get levels owned by a particular account
        • SirqulKeys.missionIds
          get missions by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.gameIds
          get games by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.packIds
          get packs by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelIds
          get game levels by specified id, comman seperated list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the application version, used to versin the game level data
        • SirqulKeys.includeHigherVersionPacks
          default is false and will not include any packs that have levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        • SirqulKeys.includeHigherVersionLevels
          default is false and will not include any levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        • SirqulKeys.responseGroups
          use response groups to include large parts of the structure. possible values are:
          MISSION_DEFAULT (default) - include the default mission (built-in packs), excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_SAVED - include saved levels, excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_COMMUNITY - include community levels, excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_INVITED (default) - include challenges sent to user
          PROFILE (default) - include entire profile
          PROFILE_DATA - only include profile date (exclude friends)
          PROFILE_FRIENDS - include friends list
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseType
          the will return the correct in app purchases for the device, possible values are:
          SIRQUL (default) - purchasing from the sirqul store using tickets
          IOS - purchasing from the itunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
          GOOGLE - purchasing from the google android store
          AMAZON - purchasing from the amazon android store
          MAC - purchasing from the itunes store for OSX
          FREE - the item is free to purchase

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a AppResponse containing the app data on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AppDataApiBase.getAppData

      • regenerateAppData

        public void regenerateAppData(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Regenerate the app data cache for all apps

        Target API Endpoint: /app/regen

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AppDataApiBase.regenerateAppData

      • updateAppData

        public void updateAppData(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<AppResponse> callback)

        Publish the application data structure. Can be used to save levels and scores. It then returns the application data structure.

        The basic structure is a node tree, with the root node being a AppResponse. The response contains the user's profile, messages from the system, and a list of MissionResponse. A mission can have any number of GameResponses but typically is a single game type. A game then has any number of PackResponses which help group the game levels. Packs are then composed of any number of GameLevelResponse s.

        Using the various parameters can return the applications default mission (built-in packs to play), the list of community levels published, the user's saved levels, or explicity levels desired. You can choose to include the profile or not, or just return parts of the profile. You can also filter out game levels that have been published with a higher version of the application.

        Target API Endpoint: /app/post

        Available parameters for this api

        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required).
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          if true then include the game data blob, otherwise don't include.
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          string used to filter the search results when looking for community and saved levels.
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          how to sort the results when looking for community and saved levels. possible values are:
          LEVEL_NAME, LEVEL_CREATED, LEVEL_UPDATED, LEVEL_LIKES, LEVEL_DISLIKES, LEVEL_NOTES, LEVEL_PLAYS.
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          order the search results descending or ascending when looking for community and saved levels.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.gameObjectCount
          if true then include the game object count, otherwise don't include.
        • SirqulKeys.filter
          restrict the search to items with certain permissions, possible values are:
          MINE, FRIENDS, PUBLIC, ALL_PUBLIC, ALL, LIKED
        • SirqulKeys.dateCreated
          restrict the search to items created less then date
        • SirqulKeys.ownerId
          get levels owned by a particular account
        • SirqulKeys.missionIds
          get missions by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.challengeIds
          get challeneges by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.gameIds
          get games by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.packIds
          get packs by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelIds
          get game levels by specified id, list of long ids
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the application version, used to versin the game level data
        • SirqulKeys.includeHigherVersionPacks
          default is false and will not include any packs that have levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        • SirqulKeys.includeHigherVersionLevels
          default is false and will not include any levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        • SirqulKeys.responseGroups
          use response groups to include large parts of the structure. possible values are:
          MISSION_DEFAULT (default) - include the default mission (built-in packs), excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_SAVED - include saved levels, excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_COMMUNITY - include community levels, excludes all other mission groups
          MISSION_INVITED (default) - include challenges sent to user
          PROFILE (default) - include entire profile
          PROFILE_DATA - only include profile date (exclude friends)
          PROFILE_FRIENDS - include friends list
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseType
          the will return the correct in app purchases for the device, possible values are:
          SIRQUL (default) - purchasing from the sirqul store using tickets
          IOS - purchasing from the itunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
          GOOGLE - purchasing from the google android store
          AMAZON - purchasing from the amazon android store
          MAC - purchasing from the itunes store for OSX
          FREE - the item is free to purchase
        • SirqulKeys.data
          an AppResponse object that includes just the data being saved, those nodes should be marked with an action of SAVE or DELETE

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a AppResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AppDataApiBase.updateAppData
